request_pathways.name: Authorization for Release of Medical/Confidential Information
Mail to P.O. Box 159, Tioga, ND 58852

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient must download a generic third-party release authorization form, print and handwrite it, then fax or mail it to the HIM department.

red_flags: Witness signature line present as structured field, implying it may be expected — not required by HIPAA for patient access
Image-only scanned PDF with no text layer — inaccessible to screen readers and non-compliant with Section 508/ADA
bright_spots: Granular record type selection with 12 checkbox categories gives patients meaningful control over disclosure scope
Clear voluntariness statement: patients explicitly told they can refuse to sign without affecting treatment
Dual format availability (PDF + Word) provides an alternative path for digital completion

findability.rationale: Level 4: Form is easy to find via basic web search; HIM page is accessible from site navigation and directly links to the form in two formats.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: Primary PDF is an image-only scan with zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite workflow; Word version exists as a partial workaround but the process remains primarily paper-based.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate single-page form with logical flow and granular record-type checkboxes, but marred by a dense unformatted legal paragraph, unlabeled internal tracking fields, and confusing appointment-date fields.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: Patient self-access is not addressed; the Release From/To structure assumes third-party disclosure, with no mention of HIPAA Right of Access or guidance for patients requesting their own records.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Includes good voluntariness and revocation disclosures, but the witness signature line may exceed HIPAA requirements for patient access and the form fails to reference patient access rights under § 164.524.

overall.summary: Tioga Medical Center's records request process is easy to find but hindered by an image-only scanned form designed for third-party release, not patient self-access.
